page.shortlink: api client api a5 listbox item object

discussion.p: Custom items can be used in the list by adding the "a5-item" attribute to an element in the list. This attribute should contain the name of the custom item to call when the user interacts with the element. It can also include arguments to be passed to the item events by including a ":" after the item name, followed by arguments specific to the item.

property.name: selectable
property.description: Whether or not the custom item allows the list row to be selected.

property.name: onClick
property.description: Event fired when a custom item is clicked.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The tender index of the list row. If the custom item is not in a row, the "index" will be "false".

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the list row.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Any arguments specific to the custom item.

property.name: onDblClick
property.description: Event fired when a custom item is double clicked.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The tender index of the list row. If the custom item is not in a row, the "index" will be "false".

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the list row.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Any arguments specific to the custom item.

property.name: onRightClick
property.description: Event fired when a custom item is context clicked.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The tender index of the list row. If the custom item is not in a row, the "index" will be "false".

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the list row.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Any arguments specific to the custom item.

property.name: onDown
property.description: Event fired when the user presses down on a custom item.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The tender index of the list row. If the custom item is not in a row, the "index" will be "false".

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the list row.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Any arguments specific to the custom item.

property.name: onDown
property.description: Event fired when the user releases after having presses down on a custom item.

argument.name: index
argument.description: The tender index of the list row. If the custom item is not in a row, the "index" will be "false".

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value of the list row.

argument.name: arguments
argument.description: Any arguments specific to the custom item.

page.example: <!-- in this example when the user interactions with the button, the "showDetails" custom item will be used assuming the list data has a column named "CustomerID", and that this HTML was inserted into the list row layout, the argument for the "showDetails" custom item events would be that value. --> <button a5-item="showDetails:{CustomerID}">View</button>
